column5: Any recomendations on a tackle shops near Brantford.  I'm looking for large spinner baits for musky and pike and can't seem to find any.  I'm running low my go to bait.......white, large willow leaf blade, safety pin style spinners.  Thanks for your help.
H&H Tackle   (519) 753-4226 Address : RR 8 1053 Colborne St E Brantford, ON , N3T5M1  give them a call
Thanks.....but i tried them and they don't have what i'm looking for.  Thanks again for the reply
Fishing World in Hamilton is just a quick trek down the 403.  Have you been there?  Lotsa stock, I just dunno what their muskie stock is like cuz I don't fish for 'em.
J B's Fishing Depot   (416) 614-7222 Address : Suite 6 24 Ronson Dr Etobicoke, ON , M9W1B4  I know it's a bit of a drive but worth it They have what you need just call them
grimsby tackle shouold have what you need.  i haven't been for a couple of years but they stocked muskie stuff
my dads friend makes bass style musky baits and i think normal in-lines to

Angling Outfitters 684460 Hwy 2 West Phone: (519) 539 5494  Just on the other site of Woodstock at their new location.  Last time I was in there at the old location they had some Musky lures, now that they have expanded they may have more.  Check out this link for a OFC review: http://www.ofncommunity.com/forums/index.php?showtopic=17757

Bit of a drive, but Le Baron has great prices and selection.  See their catalogue online.  Compare their prices with other tackle stores and I'm sure you'll be glad you did.  I must sound like their spokesperson.  I swear I have no stake in it nor do I know anyone with a stake in it.  I'm just a loyal customer.  If they don't have it, JB's has probably the best musky selection I've seen, but be prepared to pay for it.  I've noticed they have reduced some of their prices though.  BPS has a good musky selection too, but again, you'll pay top dollar from what I've seen.  If you don't need it right away, some members have suggested Cabelas, which has good prices and saves you gas.
